DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Peer Coach-Led Intervention Improve Pain Symptoms
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator ' goal test effectiveness peer coach model among Veterans . The investigator examine feasibility implementation alongside effectiveness , shorten timeline implementation . Aim 1 ( primary aim ) : To compare 6-month ( primary endpoint ) 9-month ( sustained effect ) effect peer-supported chronic pain self-management versus control overall pain ( intensity function ) . Hypothesis 1 : Veterans peer support arm experience reduce overall pain compare control . Aim 2 ( secondary aim ) : To compare 6- 9-month effect peer-supported chronic pain self-management versus control self-efficacy , social support , pain coping , patient activation , health-related quality life , health service utilization . Hypothesis 2 : Veterans peer support arm experience great self-efficacy , social support , pain coping , patient activation , health-related quality life , low health service utilization , compare control . Aim 3 ( pre-implementation aim ) : To explore facilitator barrier implementation peer support chronic pain , intervention cost , fidelity model .
